abstract: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index has more than doubled since Barack Obama took office, an accomplishment achieved by only four other presidents.
snippet: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index has more than doubled since Barack Obama took office, an accomplishment achieved by only four other presidents.
lead_paragraph: IN the 84 years that the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index has been calculated, it doubled during the terms of only four presidents before Barack Obama’s election in 2008. This month that number rose to five as the index climbed to more than twice what it was when he took office.

headline.main: Measured by S.&P. Returns, Obama Is on a Short List
headline.print_headline: Measured by S.&P. Returns, Obama Is on a Short List
